website_summaries.verdict: If your goal in buying a pizza oven is to cook the best pizza possible, the brick oven-level heat of this option delivers well and quickly.
pros: Comes in your choice of red or gray finish
Top and bottom elements heat up to 660 degrees Fahrenheit, simulating a brick oven
Settings for thin, medium, and thick crusts
Will fit up to an 11-inch pizza
Cooks a pizza in 6 to 10 minutes
cons: any pizza over a thin crust (or piled too high with toppings) will burn

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Love the pizza maker! Pre-heat oven for 30 mins. I Roll out my dough on parchment paper and use that for direct transfer to pizza stone.8 oz crust 7-10 mins. The seller purchased several of these units from a well known company on sale ( WS) , they left the WS packing slip in unit. This seller tagged $100.00 on to sale price. Buy elsewhere. The unit itself I am very happy with.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the $!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can not believe how good this pizza is. Of course the ingredients are important, but if you have good ones, this will be one of the best pizzas you will ever eat. We roll the pizza dough so thin you can almost see through it. The heating element perfectly cooks the top and bottom of the pizza. I will never buy a pizza again (unless I’m in Italy), it is that good!
customer_reviews.author: Paul@Austin

customer_reviews.title: The temp gets real high so as to cook a perfect crust. I just wish it had an indicator ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for Christmas since he loves to make pizza. It works very well as long as you keep watching your pizza through the glass to make sure it doesn't burn. The temp gets real high so as to cook a perfect crust. I just wish it had an indicator that showed when it has reached the optimal temp to start cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Hanada Khoury

customer_reviews.title: Good pizza, hard cleaning pizza stone
customer_reviews.text: I like the product but the pizza stone is very hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Broken!
customer_reviews.text: Product came completely broken and had to return without ability to reorder or replace. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pizza oven is not practical.
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the box ,used for the first time,start fuming and burned the whole pizza,tried twice with the lower temperature,happened again,not satisfied with the product I would like to return, Thanks for Amazom service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: No better than using an oven, if you’re not careful, the top heating element will make contact with your pizza, leaving burn marks and ruining the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten Egan

customer_reviews.title: Great pizza made easy
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this. Restaurant quality thin crust pizza cooks in five minutes. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Alia

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: This pizza oven is easy to use. The pizza cooks very fast and has different settings for different crust thicknesses.
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: it makes the crust so good and tastes just like the ones from a pizza ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter, she loves it, it makes the crust so good and tastes just like the ones from a pizza parlor. worked really good and will always use this instead of the oven. It only takes 10 minutes to get a great pizza. Great gift for ones birthday fun to have this as Pizza is her favorite meal.
customer_reviews.author: Charly

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for those who like thin crust pizza with the ...
customer_reviews.text: WoW. Highly recommended for those who like thin crust pizza with the taste only a wood over can deliver.
customer_reviews.author: fdaccio

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!! Hardest part is getting the dough to roll out without wanting to shrink up.
customer_reviews.author: Sharyn Sample

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Makes good pizza,thick and thin with just a few toppings
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes my dinners!
customer_reviews.text: Makes the best home pizzas ever. Use the fresh dough from Trader Joe's (makes two pizzas) and their sauce and mozzarella, and then add whatever I have around the house. Crust is perfect. Be sure to not make the pizzas too tall. Only reason no 5 stars is the viewing window is useless after the first couple of pizzas, but we just open the lid to check now. Our stone is 7 months old and is black as night, just perfect...
customer_reviews.author: Buzzard's Roost

customer_reviews.title: Great for Thin Pizza
customer_reviews.text: There isn't a lot of clearance between the top heating element and the pizza stone. Its easy to burn toppings and cheese if they get too close to the element. This machine exceeded my expectations. Easy cleanup and very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: KohalaTom

customer_reviews.title: My only whine is that is smells pretty awful during the break-in period
customer_reviews.text: The crust this pizza makes is outstanding. Thin, crispy, even. The crust itself is ideal. My only whine is that is smells pretty awful during the break-in period. Use it outside the first few times, or you'll get a mechanical stench. But the crust is superlative. Fantastic. Yum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pizza maker!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. For a few years I’ve been making pizza on my Kamado grill. There are times I’ve wanted to make a pizza but didn’t want to go through the trouble of lighting the charcoal and waiting for the grill to reach temperature. After looking at several models I selected the Breville when I saw the reviews here and on YouTube. It’s a little more in price but well worth it. I really like the pizza stone that comes with the pizza maker. In just over a week I’ve made 3 pizzas and they all came out great.
customer_reviews.author: Garden Guy

customer_reviews.title: Works well in a cafe setting too!
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with Breville, that's why when I wanted a pizza cooker I turned to this brand. I wasn't disappointed. It heats up fast and only take 10-12 minutes to fully cook a pizza. Plenty of room for lots of toppings too. We use this in our small cafe and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: KPHawaii

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Makes the world's best crust at home. Couldn't be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: but not as happy as i wished i was
customer_reviews.text: paid a lot for this, it constantly smokes and smells when using it. not sure what trick i can figure out.. but not as happy as i wished i was.
customer_reviews.author: Little Miss Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Nasty, Burnt Pizza.
customer_reviews.text: Nasty. The reviews HAVE to be false. We tried home made. We tried their recipes. We tried frozen. We tried warming up really delicious leftover pizza. This contraption ruined them all by simultaneously burning and under-cooking each attempt. The flavor left on the pizza is smokey with an essence of machine oil. Just don't.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Best Pizza Ever!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Makes an awesome pizza. Our oven produces a lot of unpleasant smoke as I was unable to clean the stone completely no matter what I did. Because of this, we have been using it outside. I think the trick is to use parchment paper under the crust for baking to prevent ingredients from falling and burning onto the stone. I ordered a replacement stone and hopefully by covering the stone with parchment paper we will once again be able to make the pizza in the kitchen. It's a good thing as winter is right around the corner.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: I’ve already had 2, each one broke after ionly ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve already had 2 , each one broke after ionly used them a handful of times. Breville costumer service , well ,major letdown. Never keep up with they’r promises.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: I can finally after many years trying, get my crust crisp and my toppings browned! Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: R. Genovese

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I am really impressed. I went a little crazy making pizzas when it arrived..you name it, I made it. The crust comes out so good!
customer_reviews.author: S. Chagnon

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Poor instructions that are imprecise. It takes a great deal of effort to figure out the right temp to set it at. One might try to make a thin pizza but if it rises too much , it is not thin and will not cook correctly. The dough sticks to the stone and is very, very difficult to clean. I am going back to the regular oven method.
customer_reviews.author: Theotherone

customer_reviews.title: one thumb up one thumb down
customer_reviews.text: Ideal for making really good crust . I find that the bottom of the crust burns before the crust on top is done cooking :(. I also agree you cannot put a lot of toppings or it will burn on the coils , which result in a smokey kitchen. I am a little disappointed with the crust burning on the bottom. This product is costly and I feel it should make a better pizza for the cost!!!!
customer_reviews.author: LMcGowan

customer_reviews.title: Fastest way to set off your fire alarm
customer_reviews.text: Fastest way to set off your fire alarm. Can only handle super thin crust. Everything else will come in contact with the heating coils and burn. On the other hand, the crust does get crispy.
customer_reviews.author: alex kranenburg

customer_reviews.title: ... product for a wedding gift and it is the WORST, SO NOT WORTH THE EFFORT
customer_reviews.text: I got this product for a wedding gift and it is the WORST, SO NOT WORTH THE EFFORT, product I have EVER come in contact with. I feel bad that my family member actually spent so much money trying to get us a nice gift. I've used it THREE times, making sure to follow the directions exactly, thinking that maybe I was doing something wrong. Not so! Each time, it cooked unevenly and made a huge mess! I am chucking it! What a disappointment! DO NOT waste good money on this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing product from Breville
customer_reviews.text: This product is so disappointing. You have to be very careful and watch that the pizza doesn't rise up and touch the top heating element and burn. Breville says that it makes thick crust pizza but I don't see how, especially if you like a lot of sauce and toppings. It is just easier to bake pizza in the oven and not have to watch and worry about it rising too high. So you better heat your pizza stone in the oven in case you have to transfer the pizza to the oven if it rises too high.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Boyd

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Pizza stuck to stone...what a mess. It is impossible to clean The oven shuts off before the stone heats up. Customer service was not helpful and insulting. Save your money. You make a better pizza in a toster over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More difficult than it should be...and it failed
customer_reviews.text: It is tricky to find the right temperature for various kinds of pizzas so that the top and bottom are both cooked properly. Also you have to use fairly thin pizzas or the toppings get caught in the upper heating mechanism. If any of the toppings or cheese spill onto the stone it is somewhat difficult to clean the stone and the inside of the apparatus. Lastly it no longer works. It keeps tripping circuit breakers so I’m going to have to Pitch it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS PIZZA OVEN ASAP!!
customer_reviews.text: I purhcased this through another vendor and it is incredible!! Many years ago I travelled to Italy and had their version of pizza and it was incredible! I made a thin crust dough and rolled it out very thin and within 4 minutes had the 2nd best pizza I have ever had in my life! (olive oil and thinly sliced bacon!!)....Not as great as Italy, but by far 2nd best!!! This was my first pizza so i will keep you posted as time goes by.... it is bigger than I thought but WHO CARES!!
customer_reviews.author: A. S. White

customer_reviews.title: Great crust.
customer_reviews.text: Did a fantastic job with the crust. I made I thin crust pizza and it was crisp and lightly charred in about 8 minutes. One problem I had was that the top burner causes high fat cheese to release lots of oil. Next time I'm going to try adding them later.
customer_reviews.author: Phread

customer_reviews.title: I love this and it makes amazing pizzas in a really ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this and it makes amazing pizzas in a really short time. Really good for family time. We recently went to Tahoe and this was used on Pizza night and everyone loved it and how well it cooked the pizzas. I definitely have to order my own now because this is a household must have.
customer_reviews.author: Just Being Honest

customer_reviews.title: loved it for perfect single pizzas
customer_reviews.text: I used it on individual pizzas and the cooked to perfection and all the toppings were equally cooked as well. I don't want to over power my pizza with a bunch of cheese and sauce so it was just right.
customer_reviews.author: Estelita Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed and disgusted!
customer_reviews.text: Actually ordered online at Williams Sonoma(100.00). First time was the charm, after that, just a pain in the toosh. It gets so smokey, the pizza tastes smoked, I was meticulous following the directions to the letter. Found a good pizza dough. The one in the recipe book, not bad. The kitchen became so smokey had to open all doors. Do not waste your money. The stone was black and gross after 2 uses. Awful to clean. I am a an extremely experienced cook. I love my Breville smart oven, but this thing is a heavy hunk of smoking junk. I have had it for less than a month. I should have burned the money. It would've been less messy.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Beverly

customer_reviews.title: NOPE
customer_reviews.text: Despite having a "thick crust" setting, this pizza oven is not suitable for any but the most thinly rolled-out dough. There is perhaps an inch of vertical space between the stone and the heating coil, and anything that touches the heating element (and everything will, unless you're making tortillas) will be inedibly charred. I tried making naan the other day, and stretched it out as thin as possible. No toppings. Well, all the lovely yeast-fueled bubbles that puffed up had black marks from the heating coil branded on them. Had to peel off all the burnt parts. Such a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: J. F. Henken

product_meta.title: Brevile Pizza Maker, 19.5 x 12.6 x 19.2 inches, Silver
product_meta.description: Color:SilverTop and bottom heating elements elevate the heating stone to a fierce 660°, replicating a brick oven environment. Choose thin to thick dough setting and watch through a viewing window as your creation comes alive. 12” pizza in only 6 minutes similar to an intense brick-oven level heat, your pizza will be ready before you're done setting the table. brick oven conditions and bottom heating elements turn up the heat to 660° so your pizza will get fired up the right way. pizza stone The included 12” pizza stone absorbs moisture and ensures evenly distributed heat for a crispy delicious crust.
feature_bullets: Countertop pizza maker gives you professional brick-oven results, right in your own kitchen.
Dual heating elements on the top and bottom of the oven heat The ceramic pizza stone up to 660F, replicating the cooking environment of a brick oven.
Built-in 12" Diam. Baking stone conducts and retains heat evenly to crisp, golden crusts.
Settings for thin, medium and thick crusts automatically adjust cooking time and temperature to ensure uniformly baked pizzas-no matter how generous the toppings.
Bakes pizzas up to 11 inch in diameter!
